title: 114_hr5581
content: The Act may be known as the Contributions Legally Interdicted from Noncitizens To Our Nonprofits Act of 2016 or the CLINTON Act of 2016. Certain charitable organizations are prohibited from accepting contributions from individuals connected to foreign governments. The CLINTON Act of 2016 prohibits Federal official organizations from accepting contributions from individuals connected to foreign governments to maintain their tax-exempt status under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. The CLINTON Act of 2016 prohibits Federal official organizations from accepting contributions from individuals connected to foreign governments. Contributions must be returned within 30 days to avoid tax penalties. The CLINTON Act of 2016 prohibits Federal official organizations from accepting contributions from individuals connected to foreign governments. Federal officials who control or actively participate in the management of such organizations are defined in the Act. The term 'Federal official' includes individuals who have served as President, Vice-President, or held certain positions in the Federal government within a specified time period. The CLINTON Act of 2016 prohibits Federal officials from accepting contributions from individuals connected to foreign governments. Federal officials include Members of Congress, officers appointed by the President, certain positions held at the pleasure of the President, and Federal judges. The CLINTON Act of 2016 prohibits Federal officials from accepting contributions from individuals connected to foreign governments, including departments, agencies, or instrumentalities of a foreign government, public international organizations, officers or employees of such entities, and individuals connected to foreign governments within a 20-year period. The CLINTON Act of 2016 prohibits Federal officials from accepting contributions from individuals connected to foreign governments, including those related within four degrees of consanguinity to certain persons. The amendment made by this section applies to contributions made after the enactment date in taxable years ending after such date.
